quoteLast: Early this morning I met the mail from Santa Fé, and, in accordance with the agreement between Mr. Giddings and myself to incorporate our two stocks, so as to perform the tri-monthly service, I sent back a portion of my own party, with orders to return as far as Fort Clarke.
title: Report to Hon. A. V. Brown, Postmaster-General

quoteLast: the whole of the first objective was in our hands.

quoteFirst: While he was still loitering, the clock of York Minster chimed the half-hour past five. Cabs rattled by him over the bridge on their way to meet the train from London, at
quoteLast: . After a moment’s hesitation, the captain sauntered after the cabs. When it is one of a man’s regular habits to live upon his fellow-creatures, that man is always more or less fond of haunting large railway stations.

quoteFirst: The great island of Lewis, formerly so distant from Edinburgh and Glasgow, can now be reached in fourteen hours by one who leaves the latter city at
quoteLast: The old route was very tiresome and circuitous: the traveller had to proceed to Inverness, take the Dingwall and Skye line to Strome Ferry, and then sail over the Minch to Stornoway. The opening up of the West Highlands by the railway to Mallaig has changed all that.

quoteFirst: The General's Staff reached the western outlet of Sorinnes at 4 a.m. The 23rd Infantry Division, present at the same point, immediately reported its readiness for opening fire; the 32nd Infantry Division, communication with which was at first lacking, did not report until
quoteLast: At 5.55 a.m. the Commander-in-Chief gave the order to fire, which, at first, could not be complied with on account of the thick weather.
title: The German Army in Belgium, the White Book of May 1915

quoteFirst: At forty-seven minutes after twelve he rose from table and went into the drawing-room; there the servant handed him an uncut copy of _The Times_, which Phileas Fogg folded and cut with a dexterity which denoted a practised hand. The perusal of this journal occupied him till a quarter to four, and then _The Standard_ sufficed till dinner-time. This repast was eaten under the same conditions as his breakfast, and at
quoteLast: he returned to the saloon and read _The Morning Chronicle_.
title: Round the World in Eighty Days
